definition: to be fond of/to like/to enjoy/to be happy/to feel pleased/happiness/delight/glad
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: Lantern Festival day everywhere decorated, beaming.
sentences.chinese: 元宵节这天到处张灯结彩，喜气洋洋。

sentences.english: The whole square was alive with singing and rejoicing.
sentences.chinese: 整个广场歌声嘹亮，喜气洋洋。

sentences.english: Liverpool were in a jubilant mood after their cup victory.
sentences.chinese: 利物浦队夺得优胜杯后喜气洋洋。

sentences.english: Behind him are his proud parents, loaded down with his luggage.
sentences.chinese: 在他后面，喜气洋洋的父母帮他拿着沉重的行李。

sentences.english: Liverpool is in a jubilant mood after their cup victory.
sentences.chinese: 利物浦队夺得优胜杯后喜气洋洋。

sentences.english: Zhu Peng Year of the Tiger faithful joyous, everything Shun Italy, good luck happy.
sentences.chinese: 祝朋友们虎年喜气洋洋，事事顺意，吉祥快乐。

sentences.english: Something to reach back out to whoever is out there beaming signals at us.
sentences.chinese: 一件事情，达到回出谁在那里我们的信号是喜气洋洋。

sentences.english: A ray illuminated Cosette's pale face.
sentences.chinese: 珂赛特苍白的脸上顿时喜气洋洋。

sentences.english: You see all characters in the pictures are happy and cheerful, showing a lively and exciting atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 你看，画里的人看上去都是喜气洋洋的，热闹非凡。

sentences.english: Mr Tube a beaming moved into a new house.
sentences.chinese: 管先生一家喜气洋洋的搬入新居。

sentences.english: I found myself beaming idiotically through this adorable comedy of manners.
sentences.chinese: 我发现自己通过这种方式喜气洋洋可爱的喜剧白痴。

sentences.english: One of China Shipbuilding Corporation's new efforts, the Cemtex Hunter, at its christening ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 中船喜气洋洋的为新船裕亨轮，举行交船命名典礼。

sentences.english: There is an indescribable aurora in beaming old age.
sentences.chinese: 在喜气洋洋的老年有着一种无以名之的曙光。

definition: to be decorated with lanterns and colored banners (idiom)
grinning from ear to ear (idiom)/beaming with happiness
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
